notesStmt.note: Censored by Clemente Renatto, Italian censor: inscribed with his name (folio 97v). Censored by Giovanni Domenico Carretto, Italian censor (active 1600-1624): inscribed with his name, 1618 (folio 97r); see 100-101, and appendix § 80-84. Partially illegible ownership entries, folio 2r. Yom Ṭov, folio 3r; Ḥayim, folio 4r.Bibliographical remarks of Joseph Almanzi: 1r (i.e. recto of the first flyleaf). There are some additional lines by Yoel Almanzi, dated Padua 1846, on the verso of the same leaf.
Manuscript description based on Margoliouth, G.: Catalogue of the Hebrew and Samaritan Manuscripts in the British Museum, London 1965.

msItem.title: Sefer sheḳel ha-ḳodesh ספר שקל הקדש

supportDesc.foliation: There is a later pagination in Italian cursive in the left-hand upper corner of each recto and the right-hand upper corner of each verso.

scriptDesc.scriptNote: Sefardi semi-cursive script of the 16th century.

binding.p: BM/BL in-house. Blue hard cover. Spine: 'Moses ben Shemtob. Shekel Hak-Kodesh. Hebrew. Brit. Mus. Additional 27,044.'

history.provenance: Acquisition: Giuseppe Almanzi (b. 1801, d. 1860), bibliophile his manuscript no. 150; his library including 322 medieval Hebrew manuscripts were purchased en bloc by the British Museum through Asher & Co. in October 1865 for £1,000 through Asher & Co., Berlin dealer to the British Museum (see 131-153); inscribed, folio [98v] (fse001v).
